verses.kjv: Would to God ye could bear with me a little in my folly: and indeed bear with me.
verses.web: I wish that you would bear with me in a little foolishness, but indeed you do bear with me.
verses.ct: I wish you'd put up with a little foolishness from me — and actually, you already are, so thank you.

verses.kjv: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
verses.web: For I am jealous over you with a godly jealousy. For I married you to one husband, that I might present you as a pure virgin to Christ.
verses.ct: I'm jealous for you, and it's a godly jealousy. I promised you to one husband — Christ — so I could present you to him as a pure virgin.

verses.kjv: But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.
verses.web: But I am afraid that somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve in his craftiness, so your minds might be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.
verses.ct: But I'm afraid that just as the serpent tricked Eve with his cunning, your minds might be led astray from the simple and pure devotion you have to Christ.

verses.kjv: For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with him.
verses.web: For if he who comes preaches another Jesus, whom we didn’t preach, or if you receive a different spirit, which you didn’t receive, or a different “good news”, which you didn’t accept, you put up with that well enough.
verses.ct: Because if someone comes along and preaches a different Jesus than the one we preached, or offers you a different spirit than the one you received, or a different gospel than the one you accepted — you seem perfectly happy to put up with it!

verses.kjv: For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.
verses.web: For I reckon that I am not at all behind the very best apostles.
verses.ct: I don't consider myself the least bit inferior to those so-called "super-apostles."

verses.kjv: But though I be rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.
verses.web: But though I am unskilled in speech, yet I am not unskilled in knowledge. No, in every way we have been revealed to you in all things.
verses.ct: I may not be a polished speaker, but I certainly know what I'm talking about. We've made that clear to you in every possible way.

verses.kjv: Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?
verses.web: Or did I commit a sin in humbling myself that you might be exalted, because I preached to you God’s Good News free of charge?
verses.ct: Was it wrong of me to humble myself so that you could be lifted up? Did I sin by preaching God's gospel to you free of charge?

verses.kjv: I robbed other churches, taking wages of them, to do you service.
verses.web: I robbed other assemblies, taking wages from them that I might serve you.
verses.ct: I took financial support from other churches — essentially letting them pay my way — so I could serve you.

verses.kjv: And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all things I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and so will I keep myself.
verses.web: When I was present with you and was in need, I wasn’t a burden on anyone, for the brothers, when they came from Macedonia, supplied the measure of my need. In everything I kept myself from being burdensome to you, and I will continue to do so.
verses.ct: When I was with you and ran short on money, I didn't burden any of you. The brothers who came from Macedonia covered what I needed. I've made it a point never to be a financial burden to you, and I intend to keep it that way.

verses.kjv: As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
verses.web: As the truth of Christ is in me, no one will stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
verses.ct: As surely as the truth of Christ lives in me, no one in all of Achaia will take this boast away from me.

verses.kjv: Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.
verses.web: Why? Because I don’t love you? God knows.
verses.ct: Why do I insist on this? Is it because I don't love you? God knows that's not true.

verses.kjv: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.
verses.web: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from those who desire an occasion, that in which they boast, they may be found even as we.
verses.ct: I'll keep doing exactly what I'm doing so I can cut the ground out from under those who are looking for an excuse to claim they work on the same terms we do.

verses.kjv: For such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.
verses.web: For such men are false apostles, deceitful workers, masquerading as Christ’s apostles.
verses.ct: These people are false apostles — dishonest workers who disguise themselves as apostles of Christ.

verses.kjv: And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.
verses.web: And no wonder, for even Satan masquerades as an angel of light.
verses.ct: That shouldn't surprise anyone. Even Satan disguises himself as an angel of light.

verses.kjv: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.
verses.web: It is no great thing therefore if his servants also masquerade as servants of righteousness, whose end will be according to their works.
verses.ct: So it's no big deal if his servants also disguise themselves as servants of righteousness. In the end, they'll get exactly what their actions deserve.

verses.kjv: I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.
verses.web: I say again, let no one think me foolish. But if so, yet receive me as foolish, that I also may boast a little.
verses.ct: Let me say it again: don't think I'm a fool. But even if you do, at least hear me out the way you'd humor a fool, so I can do a little boasting of my own.

verses.kjv: That which I speak, I speak it not after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
verses.web: That which I speak, I don’t speak according to the Lord, but as in foolishness, in this confidence of boasting.
verses.ct: What I'm about to say isn't something the Lord told me to say. I'm speaking like a fool, with this bold confidence of boasting.

verses.kjv: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.
verses.web: Seeing that many boast after the flesh, I will also boast.
verses.ct: Since so many others are boasting about their human credentials, I'll boast too.

verses.kjv: For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye yourselves are wise.
verses.web: For you bear with the foolish gladly, being wise.
verses.ct: After all, you're so wise that you gladly put up with fools!

verses.kjv: For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour you, if a man take of you, if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.
verses.web: For you bear with a man if he brings you into bondage, if he devours you, if he takes you captive, if he exalts himself, or if he strikes you on the face.
verses.ct: You put up with anyone who enslaves you, exploits you, takes advantage of you, puts on airs, or even slaps you in the face.

verses.kjv: I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.
verses.web: I speak by way of disparagement, as though we had been weak. Yet in whatever way anyone is bold (I speak in foolishness), I am bold also.
verses.ct: I'm ashamed to admit that we were apparently too "weak" for that kind of behavior. But whatever anyone else dares to boast about — I'm speaking foolishly here — I dare to boast about it too.

verses.kjv: Are they Hebrews? so am I. Are they Israelites? so am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so am I.
verses.web: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the offspring of Abraham? So am I.
verses.ct: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they descendants of Abraham? So am I.

verses.kjv: Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.
verses.web: Are they servants of Christ? (I speak as one beside himself.) I am more so: in labors more abundantly, in prisons more abundantly, in stripes above measure, and in deaths often.
verses.ct: Are they servants of Christ? I know this sounds insane, but I'm an even better one. I've worked harder, been thrown in prison more often, been beaten beyond what anyone should survive, and faced death again and again.

verses.kjv: Of the Jews five times received I forty stripes save one.
verses.web: Five times I received forty stripes minus one from the Jews.
verses.ct: 5 times the Jewish authorities gave me 39 lashes.

verses.kjv: Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;
verses.web: Three times I was beaten with rods. Once I was stoned. Three times I suffered shipwreck. I have been a night and a day in the deep.
verses.ct: 3 times I was beaten with rods. Once I was stoned. 3 times I survived shipwrecks. I once spent a full night and day adrift in the open sea.

verses.kjv: In journeyings often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in perils by mine own countrymen, in perils by the heathen, in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness, in perils in the sea, in perils among false brethren;
verses.web: I have been in travels often, perils of rivers, perils of robbers, perils from my countrymen, perils from the Gentiles, perils in the city, perils in the wilderness, perils in the sea, perils among false brothers;
verses.ct: I've been constantly on the move, facing danger from rivers, danger from robbers, danger from my own people, danger from Gentiles, danger in the city, danger in the wilderness, danger at sea, and danger from people pretending to be fellow believers.

verses.kjv: In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.
verses.web: in labor and travail, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, and in cold and nakedness.
verses.ct: I've known exhausting labor and hardship, many sleepless nights, hunger and thirst, going without food over and over, and exposure to cold without enough clothing.

verses.kjv: Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.
verses.web: Besides those things that are outside, there is that which presses on me daily: anxiety for all the assemblies.
verses.ct: On top of all that, I carry the daily pressure of my concern for all the churches.

verses.kjv: Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?
verses.web: Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is caused to stumble, and I don’t burn with indignation?
verses.ct: When someone is weak, I feel that weakness. When someone is led into sin, it burns me up inside.

verses.kjv: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.
verses.web: If I must boast, I will boast of the things that concern my weakness.
verses.ct: If I have to boast, I'll boast about the things that show my weakness.

verses.kjv: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.
verses.web: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus Christ, he who is blessed forever more, knows that I don’t lie.
verses.ct: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus Christ — who is praised forever — knows I'm not lying.

verses.kjv: In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:
verses.web: In Damascus the governor under King Aretas guarded the Damascenes’ city, desiring to arrest me.
verses.ct: In Damascus, the governor serving under King Aretas posted guards around the city to have me arrested.

verses.kjv: And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.
verses.web: I was let down in a basket through a window by the wall, and escaped his hands.
verses.ct: But my friends lowered me in a basket through a window in the city wall, and I escaped his grasp.
